text:
Stevens County is a county in Washington in the United States. It is along the Canada–US border. The county seat is Colville. 43,531 people lived there at the 2010 census.
History.
The county was created on January 20, 1863. It is named after Isaac Stevens, the first governor of Washington Territory.
Geography.
The U.S. Census Bureau says that the county has a total area of. Of that is land and (2.5%) is water.
